Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is damaged but traces of a dark-brown resinous deposit survive, the exterior is covered with a brown-coloured slip and remains of thirteen lines of black-painted, closely-packed, Coptic text.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393246) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393246)
